overview_of_class: In this course we will learn the theory and conceptual framework underlying Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT). We will explore, from an empirical perspective, the usefulness of CBT when used to treat various disorders (Mood, Anxiety, Psychotic, etc.). Additionally, we will discuss specific, clinical skills used by mental health professionals who practice CBT. Carries science credit.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this course we will learn the theory and conceptual framework underlying Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT). We will explore, from an empirical perspective, the usefulness of CBT when used to treat various disorders (Mood, Anxiety, Psychotic, etc.). Additionally, we will discuss specific, clinical skills used by mental health professionals who practice CBT. Carries science credit.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Some introductory psychology coursework preferred. Email instructor with questions.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Goals:
Successful engagement and completion of the course will result in you being able to do the following:
1) Describe CBT and basic skills used when providing CBT.
2) Consume and describe research findings pertaining to the effectiveness of CBT for multiple disorders.
3) Describe your experience using some CBT skills.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
This textbook is an excellent clinical resource to have, for now and years to come:

Craske, M. (2010). Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy. APA. Washington, D.C.

I suggest purchasing a used version of these to save money.
